NetData::GlobalVariable

NetData::GlobalVariable Class Reference

GlobalVariable reference a global variable visible from all process. The semantic of update on write and update on read could be parametrized. Update may be propagate on each new computed value or after a fixed period of time. The same may be defined while a process is reading a variable. More...

Detailed Description

GlobalVariable reference a global variable visible from all process. The semantic of update on write and update on read could be parametrized. Update may be propagate on each new computed value or after a fixed period of time. The same may be defined while a process is reading a variable.

Member Enumeration Documentation

Enumerator:
UPDATE_ONACCESS 
UPDATE_TIMEOUT 
UPDATE_NO 
enum NetData::GlobalVariable::Management

Kind of management of the variable in case of multithreaded computation. PRIVATE: a copy of the variable remains private for each thread SHARED: the variable is shared among the thread, each access is locked AUTO: depending on the size of the data, the variable is shared or private. In case on inconsistent definition of the variable between multiple thread, the

Enumerator:
PRIVATE 
SHARED 
AUTO

void NetData::GlobalVariable::initialize ( const std::string &  name,
const Util::Format *  fmt,
const UpdateFunctionFormat *  fmt_update,
int  flagw,
int  flagr,
int  flag = AUTO,
void(*)(void *)  callback = 0,
void *  arg = 0 
)

Initialization of a global variable Coherency of write access and read access should be defined.

Parameters:
name the name of the variable
fmt_update the format of the update function
flagw is a value of Coherency enumeration
flagr is a value of Coherency enumeration
flag is a value from MonotonicBound::SHARED, MonotonicBound::PRIVATE, MonotonicBound::AUTO
callback is call on each update of the variable if fmt_data !=0
arg is the argument of the callback function
